page.title: 05HOUSING - IGHTHAM SQUARE (2)
page.content: many people staying that there was not enough room for everybody.{My Grand- {dad, Mr. Fielder, used to work in the {kitchen at The Chequers.}Many years ago,The George and Dragon was owned by Lord Stafford. In one of the rooms he scratched out his Coat of Arms above the fireplace, (it can still be seen today) before the King's men came and arrested him in connection with{The {Gunpowder Plot.}Next day he was hanged. Other houses of note in the Square are:{The Tudor Cottage}which stands behind the War Memorial,{Old {Stones,}once inhabited by Benjamin Harrison (a local historian of some renown) and {Bank Cottage.} Running through the Square is a brook known as{The Busty.}It is also called{The Shode Stream.
